intro: Epicharis hoaensis, commonly known as the Hoaense epicharis, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Epicharis hoaensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its leaves are usually elliptical and glossy, providing a striking contrast to its delicate floral displays.
